Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the impact of the excise tax on "those making less than $200,000" by stating that they will be hit the hardest.
Understate: The claim may understate the potential impact of the excise tax on individuals making more than $200,000.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough supporting evidence or data to prove that the excise tax will hit "those making less than $200,000" the hardest.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the excise tax will be passed on to consumers in the form of higher premiums without providing sufficient evidence for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or factors that may contribute to the impact of the excise tax, such as potential changes in employer-provided health plans or wages.
